headline: NRC Renews Operating Licenses for Clinton & Dresden; Constellation Investing $370 Million in State-of-the-Art Upgrades to Keep These Illinois Nuclear Facilities Online, Meet Rising Power Demand and Support Economic Growth
summary: WARRENVILLE, Ill., December 16, 2025--The NRC has approved a 20-year license renewals for Constellation’s Clinton Clean Energy Center and Dresden Clean Energy Center.

headline: Biggest US Power Auction Set to Deepen Affordability Concerns
summary: The results due late Wednesday will confirm what PJM Interconnection LLC — the nation’s largest grid operator, serving millions of Americans from Chicago to Washington, DC — will pay power generators to secure capacity starting in 2027.  The bill is expected to reach $17 billion, according to a Bloomberg survey of grid experts, policymakers and traders.  Surging utility bills are already shaping up to be an issue in the congressional midterm elections next year: Despite President Donald Trump saying electricity prices would be halved within a year of taking office, costs have increased.
